channel.title: [fixed]
channel.description:
The title says it all. I was populating a city at a time (add NPCS, shops, fightable NPC's, chat, etc.) and I went to test all the chat out. I talked to one of the NPC's, and got a surprise. And all the other NPC's I talk to have the same problem; their head in the chatbox is broken apart in itty-bitty pieces. see the image below for what I mean.
Any idea what I did wrong?
[img]http://img39.imageshack.us/img39/2972/chathead.png[/img]

item.title: [fixed]
item.dc:creator: @Wiplayer Wiplayer
item.description:
@Wiplayer wrote:

All the NPC’s have that problem though.
I’ll try Delta’s and report back.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 17, 2009, 02:51:28 pm[/size][hr]LOL! OMG! I feel like a noob. On Galkon’s post there were some bugfixes that I must of missed. Tried thoose, and everything works again. Thank you everyone for you other ideas too. NExt time I will learn to check stuff twice.

Fixed. =)

Read full topic

item.title: [fixed]
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

well everyone uses bluurs/delta clients lately

but maybe its just that npc?

try a different npc

item.title: [fixed]
item.dc:creator: @Wiplayer Wiplayer
item.description:
@Wiplayer wrote:

Well… “sendFrame75(npcid, 4883);” was the code for the chathead. Yaaay. =)
I removed it, but it without the head dialogue doesn’t really look nice. I’ll try changing my client. Any suggestions for a good client base? I was using Galkon’s manufactured client.

Read full topic

item.title: [fixed]
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

its a model error obviously in ur client

not fixable unles ur really good at cache editing
just start fresh

Read full topic

item.title: [fixed]
item.dc:creator: @Wiplayer Wiplayer
item.description:
@Wiplayer wrote:

I would, but I’m still learning Java, so some stuff takes me awhile to do correctly. I don’t know how complex re-writing the chat system would be.

Found the code for npcChat(). I can’t figure out which sendFrame does the chathead. perhaps sendFrame75(npcid, 4883);???

public void npcChat(String line1, int npcid) { sendFrame200(4883, 591); sendFrame126(GetNpcName(npcid).replaceAll("_", " "), 4884); sendFrame126(line1, 4885); sendFrame126("Click here to continue.", 4886); sendFrame75(npcid, 4883); sendFrame164(4882); NpcDialogueSend = true; }

Read full topic

item.title: [fixed]
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“Wiplayer, post:9, topic:309114”]>_> Why? Without dialogue any world would be boring.
Here’s the code I used. (in this case for Zaff) (this is how it is done on the base I use)

	case 546:
				c.npcChat("Would you like to see my fine hand-crafted Magic Staff's?", 546);
				c.chatDialogue = 2;
			break;

I don’t see anything wrong with it, as it is identical to the demo that was posted on the topic for the base on dialogue.[/quote]

try recoding the npc dialouge.

Read full topic

item.title: [fixed]
item.dc:creator: @Wiplayer Wiplayer
item.description:
@Wiplayer wrote:

Lets see… I’ll look through my client java file and see if I can find any code realting to npcChat or chatDialouge. Hopefully I’ll find something. I forget, isn’t the chathead done by something like showFrame()? Or something like that? It could be a problem with that.

@ghostly: Give the poor guy a break? :eek:

Read full topic

				c.chatDialogue = 2;

item.title: [fixed]

item.description:
@Wiplayer wrote:

_> Why? Without dialogue any world would be boring.
Here’s the code I used. (in this case for Zaff) (this is how it is done on the base I use)

				c.npcChat("Would you like to see my fine hand-crafted Magic Staff's?", 546);
				c.chatDialogue = 2;
			break;

I don’t see anything wrong with it, as it is identical to the demo that was posted on the topic for the base on dialogue.
